alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 15 at 2:33PM ChST until October 16 at 10:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CHST MONDAY FOR NORTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY CONTINUES UNTIL 10 AM CHST MONDAY FOR WEST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 11 to 15 feet in the surf zone. For the High Surf Advisory, hazardous surf of 7 to 10 feet in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...For the High Surf Warning, north facing reefs. For the High Surf Advisory, west facing reefs. For the High Risk of Rip Currents, north and west facing reefs. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning and High Surf Advisory, until 10 AM ChST Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A large northerly swell emanating from distant extratropical Bolaven is bringing dangerously large breaking waves along north facing reefs.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
